twinning.description: Torbay has a historic link with Hamelin - there is evidence that both cities were founded over 1,000 years ago. Fossils dating back to the Paleolithic have been found in Torbay, and in Hamelin since 800 B.C., while there was a monastery.

city.name: Torbay
city.description: Torbay is a borough in Devon, England, administered by the unitary authority of Torbay Council. It consists of 62.87 square kilometres (24.27 sq mi) of land, spanning the towns of Torquay, Paignton and Brixham, against an east-facing natural harbour Tor Bay of the Lyme Bay sheltered part of the English Channel.

place_of_interest.name: Babbacombe model village
place_of_interest.address: Hampton Ave, Babbacombe, Torquay TQ1 3LA, United Kingdom
place_of_interest.description: A 57 year old miniature village with over 400 individual models, with architecture ranging from Medieval to Victorian. This miniature marvel is encased by Babbacombe''s award winning gardens, spanning 4.5 acres.
place_of_interest.short_description: A 57-year-old model village.
place_of_interest.image_alt: Ariel shot of the village showing the gardens and landscape.

place_of_interest.name: Kents Cavern
place_of_interest.address: 91 Ilsham Rd, Torquay TQ1 2JF, United Kingdom
place_of_interest.description: A labyrinth once occupied first by Neanderthals and some of the very first British populace. The caves are part of the English Riviera UNESCO Global Geopark and is known as one of Britain's oldest known prehistoric sites. Within the cave system, visitors can view prehistoric fossils and cave formations.
place_of_interest.short_description: A prehistoric cave system.
place_of_interest.image_alt: Interior view of Kent's Cavern.

place_of_interest.name: Torre Abbey museum
place_of_interest.address: The King's Drive, Torquay TQ2 5JE, United Kingdom
place_of_interest.description: Torbay's most historic building dating back to 1196, encased within garden and parkland spanning across 18 acres. The historic building also hosts a multi-award wining art collection with over 600 works of art from the 18th century to the present day.
place_of_interest.short_description: A 450 acre country park.
place_of_interest.image_alt: Torre Abbey, side entrance

place_of_interest.name: Cockington Court
place_of_interest.address: Cockington Ln, Torquay TQ2 6XA, United Kingdom
place_of_interest.description: A quaint 450 acre country park with scenic garden landscapes, parkland and woodland. Within the vast countryside landscape resides a historic country manor house governed by the Torbay Coast and Countryside Trust.
place_of_interest.short_description: Centuries-old country estate.
place_of_interest.image_alt: Cockington Court Craft Centre

place_of_interest.name: Oddicombe beach
place_of_interest.address: Babbacombe Downs Rd, Torquay TQ1 3LS, United Kingdom
place_of_interest.description: A stunning beach part of the English Riviera UNESCO Global Geopark, that offers fun for all the family. The beach not only offers great views, but also offers watersports, beach shops and a caf√©.
place_of_interest.short_description: A popular beach on the english riviera.
place_of_interest.image_alt: Oddicombe Beach from Babbacombe Downs.

place_of_interest.name: Babbacombe Cliff Railway
place_of_interest.address: Babbacombe Downs Rd, Torquay TQ1 3LF, United Kingdom
place_of_interest.description: A 720 foot long cliff railway that links babbacombe Downs to oddicombe beach. The cliff railway is run by a community interest company, and gives rides to nearly 100,000 people per year.
place_of_interest.short_description: A cliff lift to Oddicombe beach.
place_of_interest.image_alt: The lower station of the cliff railway.

place_of_interest.name: South Devon University
place_of_interest.address: Long Rd, Paignton TQ4 7EJ, United Kingdom
place_of_interest.description: A TEF gold rated university that offers a wide range of programmes of study, varying from the sciences to art. The university also has relations with the University of Plymouth, in partnership they provide higher education programmes.
place_of_interest.short_description: A TEF gold rated university.
place_of_interest.image_alt: South Devon College

place_of_interest.name: The Imperial hotel
place_of_interest.address: Parkhill Rd, Torquay TQ1 2DG, United Kingdom
place_of_interest.description: The magnificent 19th Century Victorian four-star hotel commands a cliff top position, overlooking Torbay and the beautiful Devon coast. A historic property, built in the town‚Äôs Victorian period, the hotel is a reminder of why this part of Devon became known as the English Riviera.
place_of_interest.short_description: The foundation stone of the hotel was laid on 28th March 1864 on the site of the Royal Hotel plus two nearby villas. The hotel only settled on its name in May 1866 when the first advertisements were due to appear in the national newspapers and ‚ÄúImperial‚Äù was a popular name for Victorian seaside hotels.
place_of_interest.image_alt: The view of the Imperial Hotel.

place_of_interest.name: Princess Theatre
place_of_interest.address: Torbay Rd, Torquay TQ2 5EZ, United Kingdom
place_of_interest.description: South Devon's largest theatre with 1,500 seats, that have hosted artists like the Beatles and comedians like Dawn French. The theatre also hosts operas, musicals, pantomimes; concerts and comedy shows.
place_of_interest.short_description: A 1,500 seat theatre.
place_of_interest.image_alt: The Princess Theatre, Torquay

place_of_interest.name: Paignton zoo
place_of_interest.address: Totnes Rd, Paignton TQ4 7EU, United Kingdom
place_of_interest.description: A zoo apart of the South West Environmental Parks and is owned by the Wild Planet Trust . The zoo offers over 2000 animals spread over 80 acres. The zoo also offers a wide variety of activities other than observing the animals, such as a jungle themed railway, a nature trail and play areas.
place_of_interest.short_description: A zoo with over 2000 animals.
place_of_interest.image_alt: The Paignton Zoo's logo

city.name: Hamelin
city.description: A town best known for the Grimm Brothers's Pied Piper of Hamelin.

place_of_interest.name: Hamelin Old Town
place_of_interest.address: Hamelin, Germany
place_of_interest.description: A fairy tale esque street with a connection to the Pied Piper of Hamelin, a story written by the Brothers Grimm. The old town is bustling with street caf√©s, restaurants and beer gardens. One of its most famous summer attractions is the re-enactment on the Pied Piper of Hamelin.
place_of_interest.short_description: A fairytale esque street with a connection to the Pied Piper.
place_of_interest.image_alt: St.Nikolai-Kirche Rinteln.

place_of_interest.name: Museum Hameln
place_of_interest.address: Osterstra√üe 8B, 31785 Hameln, Germany
place_of_interest.description: A museum with over 1300 artefacts showcasing the history and culture of Hamelin and the Weser Uplands, but with the Pied Piper of Hamelin as its focal point.
place_of_interest.short_description: A museum showcasing the history of the Pied Piper.
place_of_interest.image_alt: The museum buildings in the form of the Stiftsherrenhaus (left) and Leisthaus (right).

place_of_interest.name: Hochzeitshaus Hamel
place_of_interest.address: Osterstra√üe 2, 31785 Hameln, Germany
place_of_interest.description: A historical house that features a unique clockwork that at the hours of 1.05pm, 3.35pm, and 5.35pm, shows the tale of the Pied Piper of Hamelin.
place_of_interest.short_description: A historic building with a famous clock.
place_of_interest.image_alt: Wedding house with chimes. In the center of the facade is the bronze door that opens for the puppet play.

place_of_interest.name: Pied Piper Statue
place_of_interest.address: Osterstra√üe 15, 31785 Hameln, Germany
place_of_interest.description: There are many different Pied Piper statues all across the city of Hamelin, but this one is one of the most noteworthy because it can be found next to the Town Hall.
place_of_interest.short_description: A statue of the infamous Pied Piper.
place_of_interest.image_alt: Postcard "Gruss aus Hameln" featuring the Pied Piper of Hamelin, 1902

place_of_interest.name: Rattenf√§nger Figuren- und Glockenspiel
place_of_interest.address: Hochzeitshausterasse, Osterstra√üe 2, 31785 Hameln, Germany
place_of_interest.description: This is a clockwork representation of the tale of the Pied Piper of Hamelin and is part of the Pied Piper of Hamelin tour Rattenf√§nger Figuren- und Glockenspiel.
place_of_interest.short_description: A clockwork of the Pied Piper.
place_of_interest.image_alt: Stadtf√ºhrung in Hameln durch den Rattenf√§nger von Hameln.

place_of_interest.name: Hameln Marketing und Tourismus GmbH
place_of_interest.address: Deisterallee 1, 31785 Hameln, Germany
place_of_interest.description: The Hamelin information centre which offers a range of tours, with the most noteworthy being the Pied Piper of Hamelin tour. The information centre is also host to the Hamelin gift shop, and there are regular viewing of an award wining film about the Pied Piper's journey.
place_of_interest.short_description: The start of the Pied Piper of Hamelin Tour.
place_of_interest.image_alt: The start of the Pied Piper of Hamelin Tour.

place_of_interest.name: St. Bonifatius
place_of_interest.address: M√ºnsterkirchhof 7, 31785 Hameln, Germany
place_of_interest.description: A 13th century gothic church dedicated to a German apostle. The church's most notable features are the stain glass windows and the bell tower that can be seen in the city centre of Hamelin.
place_of_interest.short_description: A 13th Century Gothic Church.
place_of_interest.image_alt: Minster St. Boniface from the southwest.

place_of_interest.name: Marktkirche Sankt Nicolai
place_of_interest.address: Emmernstra√üe 6, 31785 Hameln, Germany
place_of_interest.description: A church that lies in the centre of Hamelin. At different points during the year, the church hosts music concerts. The church also offers climbing tours to the top of the bell tower, which offers stunning views of Hamelin.
place_of_interest.short_description: A church that lies in the centre of Hamelin.
place_of_interest.image_alt: Marktkirche ( right next to the wedding house )

place_of_interest.name: Schauglasbl√§serei im Pulverturm
place_of_interest.address: Am Pulverturm 1, 31785 Hameln, Germany
place_of_interest.description: A glass museum and workshop, where visitors can go on guided tours of glass works of art. Visitors can also participate in glass blowing workshops, where visitors can learn and create glass works of art.
place_of_interest.short_description: A glass blowing museum.
place_of_interest.image_alt: The Powder Tower, like the Haspelmath Tower, dates from the Middle Ages and was part of the fortification wall that surrounded the city of Hameln.

place_of_interest.name: Rattenf√§nger-Brunnen
place_of_interest.address: Rathauspl. 5, 31785 Hameln, Germany
place_of_interest.description: A Pied Piper statue in the middle of a fountain within the market square.
place_of_interest.short_description: A statue of the Pied Piper of Hamelin.
place_of_interest.image_alt: Us √∂llstes image of the R√∂ttenfanger is a watercolor ut 't Johr 1592. It is however blots' ne copy of a Glaasfinster what Augustin Moersperg in the Martkark tau Goslaer seihn hett.
